title: Market Capitalization and Valuation Metrics of Amcor PLC Stock

content.text: Amcor PLC currently has a market capitalization of $18.5 billion.
1. Price-to-Earnings (P/E) Ratio: The P/E ratio of Amcor PLC is 19.32, which indicates that investors are willing to pay $19.32 for every dollar of earnings.
2. Price-to-Sales (P/S) Ratio: The P/S ratio of Amcor PLC is 1.16, suggesting that investors are valuing the company at $1.16 for every dollar of sales.
3. Price-to-Book (P/B) Ratio: The P/B ratio of Amcor PLC is 2.09, indicating that investors are valuing the company at 2.09 times its book value.
4. Enterprise Value-to-EBITDA (EV/EBITDA) Ratio: The EV/EBITDA ratio of Amcor PLC is 11.89, implying that the company's enterprise value is 11.89 times its EBITDA.

Amcor PLC's market capitalization is in line with industry benchmarks, indicating a fairly valued stock. The P/E ratio is slightly higher than the industry average, suggesting that investors have higher expectations for the company's future earnings potential. The P/S ratio is lower than the industry average, indicating a relatively undervalued stock based on sales. The P/B ratio is also lower than the industry average, suggesting that investors are not valuing the company's assets as highly. The EV/EBITDA ratio is higher than the industry average, indicating that the company's enterprise value is relatively expensive compared to its EBITDA.
